result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Milton Lee Wright

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Milton Lee Wright in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Milton Lee Wright.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk for Jon Josephsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Defense will not be proceeding with plea and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court sets the deadline of 1/9/2023 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms.  Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing. Defendant to be produced. Matter adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Milton Lee Wright not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Milton Lee Wright. Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for Jon Josephsen for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing.  Defense requests adjourned plea hearing date due to pending negotiations.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter. Case adjourned to Br. 9. Plea hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Milton Lee Wright not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a Plea hearing date be scheduled.  Court schedules this for Plea Hearing. 
Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Milton Lee Wright in court by video with Attorney Katherine Graber who appears in person.  Defendant Milton Lee Wright in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Samardzic. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, appear by video. Defendant Milton Lee Wright not in court, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Court adjourn due to court conjecture. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Milton Lee Wright in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Milton Lee Wright in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Milton Lee Wright appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
